bill.title: Voluntary Public Access Improvement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.

item.latestTitle: Voluntary Public Access Improvement Act of 2018

item.text:
Voluntary Public Access Improvement Act of 2017

This bill amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to increase and extend through FY2023 the authorization of mandatory funding for the Department of Agriculture Voluntary Public Access and Habitat Incentive Program. (The program provides grants for state and tribal governments to encourage owners and operators of privately-held farm, ranch, and forest land to voluntarily make the land available for access by the public for wildlife-dependent recreation, including hunting or fishing.)
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.title: Voluntary Public Access Improvement Act of 2017
A bill to amend the Food Security Act of 1985 to authorize funding for the voluntary public access and habitat incentive program.
Voluntary Public Access Improvement Act of 2017

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
